physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Low serum cortisol level (4.1 mg/dL; reference range 5.6 to 21.3 mg/dL), extremely high plasma ACTH level (2110 pg/mL; reference range 7.7 to 22.1 pg/mL)
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 10, fludrocortisone was added. Spontaneous menarche at age 13.6 years; regular menstruations at 40-day intervals.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Low serum cortisol level (7.3 mg/dL), high plasma ACTH level (3200 pg/mL), normal serum 17α-hydroxyprogesterone level (0.1 ng/mL)
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Menarche at 14 years; menstrual cycle regular at ~1-month intervals.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Low serum cortisol level (5.1 mg/dL), high plasma ACTH level (>1300 pg/mL), with febrile seizure at age 6; diagnosed with adrenal hypoplasia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Menstruations regular at 28-day intervals at age 19.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Low serum LH and estradiol levels at age 19, suggesting sufficient estradiol to induce LH surge.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Menarche at age 14; menstrual cycle regular at ~1-month intervals.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum progesterone level around the fifth percentile.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Serum estradiol and progesterone levels monitored during pregnancy.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased progesterone levels after the luteal-placental shift.
